title: The Best of the Bob Crewe Generation (320)
description:
The Best of the Bob Crewe Generation (MP3 @ 320)

"Come alive!  You're in the Pepsi Generation!"  Or so claimed Pepsi-Cola back in 1966.  Their television advertisements featured a catchy number called "Music to Watch Girls By" that Bob Crewe turned into his first top 40 hit, the instrumental piece going to number 15 in 1967.  The 45 single release was monophonic with "Girls on the Rocks" the B side.  Their LP, "Music to Watch Girls By" featured stereo versions of both songs.

The full title of this CD is "The Best of the Bob Crew Generation: Music to Watch Girls By."  Among its 19 tracks are all of the songs from the original "Music to Watch Girls By" album except one.  Inexplicably, "Girls on the Rocks" is not included.  Why the producers would leave out "Girls on the Rocks" in favor of a monophonic version of "Music to Watch Girls By" is beyond me, but we're stuck with their decision.  I was able to find "Girls on the Rocks" on an "Oldies but Goodies" album but alas, it was the mono version, and badly recorded at that.

1.   Theme from A Man and a Woman (Un Homme et une Femme)
2.   A Lover's Concerto
3.   Anna
4.   A Felicidade [Theme from Black Orpheus]
5.   Let's Hang On
6.   Music to Watch Girls By
7.   Concrete and Clay
8.   Theme for a Lazy Girl
9.   Barbarella
10. Winter Warm
11. Melancholy Serenade
12. Where Is Your Heart? (The Song from Moulin Rouge)
13. I Will Wait for You [From the Umbrellas of Cherbourg]
14. Brother Dan
15. Wives and Lovers
16. Streetcar
17. Miniskirts in Moscow
18. Winchester Cathedral
19. Music to Watch Girls By (Mono 45 Mix)
20. Girls on the Rocks (Mono 45 Mix)
